overview: Ross Meador is a lawyer, entrepreneur, investor, teacher and philanthropist. The story of his work and evacuation from the roof of the American Embassy in Saigon has been told in several books and screenplays, his photographs of the evacuation hang in the Gerald R. Ford Presidential Museum, and his organization has been nominated twice for the Presidential Medal of Freedom. He also practiced law in Korea with Kim & Chang, Indonesia with SSEK and Vietnam with VILAF for 10 years. He is currently the Managing Partner of Rogers & Meador in Berkeley, California, and Senior Foreign Legal Advisor to Vietnam International Law Firm (VILAF) with offices in Ho Chi Minh City and Hanoi. He continues to serve on the Executive Committee of the International Section of the California Bar Association.
